title: Excellent food
text:
Amazing food.

The ground level floor is good but lower ground is dark and not very nice.

Had the 2/3 course Sunday lunch.

Both the mackerel tartare and Ham hock is good-
Starters.

The hake was excellent and the plaice as well. The beef Sunday roast was massive and amazing too.

The desert was both excellent- peanut butter and the Eton mess.

Waitering was attentive.

Love the Food in this place and will come back.

title: Excellent food
text:
Had lunch in what was the old field restaurant.
Interior looks good- redesigned for Sen.

Food was excellent-
Had the vegetarian friend spring rolls was crispy and well balanced filling . The grilled prawn mousse was excellent as you got to make up your own rice
Paper spring rolls. The prawn mouse was good as well as the shredded carrots, mango and cucumber- both outstanding.

Had the chilli and lemongrass tofu fosh was excellent with crispy tofu and the duck curry was amazing with meat that dropped off the bone with a lovely curry - both rich and taste- both excellent.

Waitering was good.

Excellent Vietnamese and quality.

title: Excellent food
text:
Luisa has opened a supper club three weeks ago. Luisa is passionate and lovely as a host.

It’s a lovely set up in the her dining area of her flat.

It’s loving home cooked food-
Make sure you are super hungry on arrival as there is a lot of food.

It’s bring your own wine.

The food was amazing- amouse bouche of three bites followed by scallops , octopus, sea bass, ray wings and pasta with crab and finish off with panna cotta and myrtho. We were extremely full at the penultimate dish.

Wonderful value for money and I hope this goes well in Edinburgh.

title: Fantastic toastie
text:
Decided to try this place after walking past.

Some interesting selection of sandwiches.

Had the pulled jackfruit toastie which taste so much like pulled pork and was excellent -Great option for vegetarians.

title: Good sushi rolls
text:
Had food via Deliveroo.

Ordered rainbow roll and tempura batter flake roll were both excellent-
Both fresh and tasted like it would be in the restaurant.

The yaki udon was subpar and the chicken katsu curry was too starchy and sweet- wasn’t that great!

Suggestions-for take away foot: go for the rolls as they travel much better.

title: Functional hotel
text:
The hotel is located about 200meters of the north Wales motorway which makes access good.

Anna who check me in was excellent and also very efficient. Check was quick and easy.

Park in loading bay to check in.
Both Validated car parking ticket free for 24 hours( exit barriers current not down) or on street parking.

Stayed in room 218 m-2nd floor end room
Facing the sea- houses in front blocked view of sea.

Room -
Slightly smaller as end of floor room
Basic, lightly at night, depressing.

Road
Can be noisy as the hotel is in front of roundabout which is the major access to colwyn bay.

Tuesday morning about 6-ish: sounded like bin collection - if facing away from shopping area.

5 mins walk to shopping centre with Morrison and 3mins to high street with take away.

Good stay- excellent value for money.

title: Disappointing visit
text:
Still in out door only dining opening of lockdown phase.

Booked via tripadvisor a week before dining.

Day before called to asked about our door heating which they didn’t have and confirmed reservation.

Arrived at 8pm on Friday 23/4- told that they decided to stop taking tripadvisor booking via the fork and no reservation on the booking list.

Waited for 20mins and got a table.
The queue for a table was all night till we left at 10pm.

Waitering was slight haphazard.

Ordered the babu Ganush- was too sweat which came with bread.
The vine leafs with rice was average.

Had the mixed grill for one: 4 different types of meat - chicken was ok , rest- poor quality meat

title: GoodLocation
text:
Good location to break journey on the north Wales route and 9 minutes away from the city centre.

Good value for money.

Arrived at 10pm.
Receptionist present and check in smooth, quick and efficient.

No life To first floor, if you have heavy bags better to stay on the ground floor.

Booked into room 89, last room on first floor -
Long walk.

Basic interior,
Spacious room with sofa/ fold out bed.

Bath room minimalist.

Comfy bed.quiet.

Good access to motorway.
place: Premier Inn Chester Central (South East) hotel

title: Reasonable Indian take away
text:
Ordered via phone and picked up. Time given was not accurate and had to wait -
Ordered 40mins before.

Ordered the keema nan and chicken madras- both average.

The chicken Madras sauce a very thick ( might have had too much thickener) and very unimaginative- chicken and madras sauce which lacked any veg- would have welcomed any veg including onions in dish.

The keema nan mince meat that looked
Psychedelic red inside!

Need to improve on accuracy of pick up time and make dishes a bit more interesting.

title: Ok stay
text:
Not much of a choice as all other hot Sam shut due to lockdown and this was a work related.

Stayed for 5 nights from a Sunday night to Friday am.
Check in was easy.

Had a room on the 3rd floor facing the south facing promenade.

Room size is good basic. No closed wardrobe and little wardrobe space.
Also no bag table so bags on the floor.
Teas and coffee facilities in room but no iron and and fridge.

Toilets again reasonable size and basic.

Dining was closed so no hot breakfast. There is a vending machine at the entrance.

Most annoying thing about the stay is that one of the two lifts was out and stuck on the ground floor so you had to walk up one flight of stairs to use the lift.

There were number of occasions overnight where it was noisy, people pleasing at 530Am with door slamming or noise from other rooms late at night so noise insulation isn’t great.

Also to be aware, there was occasions where the hotel parking was full- mostly trade people staying over.

title: Lovely Saturday lunch
text:
Lovely Christmas deco at the entrance, swift greeting and to the table.

Table sizes rather small for 2. Overpriced blackberry fizz- no alcohol served due to current covid rules but £5 for flavoured water gin mock tail is too much!

Lunch deal for £12.95 or £18.95.

Had the Cullen skink which was nice and the venison steak strips.

Didn’t have desert.

Service was good.

title: Almost a perfect trip
text:
A world leading hotel. The entrance is lovely. Interior and exterior of hotel was very nice.

The check in was easy but check out took too long.

Had room 137- which was a standard room with a terrace however just off the main thoroughfare to the piano bar. The room location is better than rooms at the back which is quiet but was very dark as a lack of sun.Door handle have a hollow design and had dust collection in it.

Pool area is small and felt crowded. Noisy children playing made it less relaxing at times and also there were people at the pool who choose to have their mobile on ring and was not using ear phones when listening to messages etc. There was also a german speaking swimming instructor barking out commands to a young boy which was uncomfortable both in terms of noise and manner.

Pool restaurant for lunch was nice- lovely service from Bettina and Tamara and the food was great.

Gym was functional but again we had the German swimming teacher who doubled as a PT doing a class which took up the space for free weights.

Positives
Tea and coffee with cake on Monday and Friday at the piano bar

Live music at 2030

The BBQ buffet on Sunday but not on Wednesday( also in negatives)
Excellent spa area with salt water pool

Underground car parking

Close walking distance to the promenade
Rooms facing the pool

Negatives
Some rooms lack privacy such as 137, 138
Not adults only - kids played at the pool and was rather noisy.

Need to remind house keeling to Resupply water, coffee capsules and body cream consistently- there was a day without coffee capsules - had to call front desk to inform.

Interior dining music is terrible in the restaurant and spoilt the mood/ ambience

Dinner at 8pm- twice too many people turned up and there was a 20minutes wait- first time sat in doors , second time- went for a drink and came back

Bbq nights- Sunday is better - lobster and stir fried prawns , Wednesday was disappointing- was stressful as you spent along time queueing for food but on the plus, we drank less alcohol as we were less often sat at the table!

title: Great place to come and watch the sunset
text:
It’s a nice promenade with shops and bars . Can be quite busy in the evening with joggers and romantic strolls.

Great place to watch the sunset.

title: Interesting area
text:
Think the Sahara desert in Gran Canaria.
An area of desert with beautiful views and fun climbs up and down the dunes. There is a nice walk path adjacent to it with a viewing area. There is also a walk area in the dunes leading to the beach.Highly Instagramable!
place: Reserva Natural Especial de Las Dunas de Maspalomas

title: Good DBB option
text:
Visited in September.

Free parking at the front.Dates concierge area.Friendly staff. Booked the dinner, bed and breakfast option.

Allocated room 37 but did not like the set up so moved to room 51.
Rooms are basic, clean and functional.

Both breakfast and dinner were good as so was service.

Excellent location for both Blenheim palace, Oxford and Bicester.

title: Absolutely excellent tasting menu
text:
We got the last table for Saturday lunch- so do call ahead to book.

Interior is modern and minimalist. There is also outdoor seating and two high chair tables.

Open view of kitchen too.

Had the tasting menu which was amazing from start to finish.food is a fusion of Asian and Spanish.

The duck croquet, pork and squid, lamb cannelloni, Foie grae main, cheese cake was amazing.

Other dishes also interesting.

Excellent service.

title: Beautiful day out
text:
Tip 1-
You have to book in advance and if your work for the nhs- is the blue light code- 30% off

Tip2-
Scan the QR code for the free app tour- bring your headphones.

Tip3-
Don’t rush- you probably could do the tour comfortably in 1 hour.

Tip 4-
Go to the formal gardens and also the monument.

Amazing house steeped in history.
Beautiful interior and favourite room was the long hall and the dining room geared up for Halloween.

Great activity pending weather due to outdoor for gardens and also waiting queue for entrance.

title: Good lunch
text:
Located 10 mins away from Milton Keynes and has parking at the back. The interior is pub like with a restaurant in the back.

Food good- had the vegetation wellington and the super salad with addition of baked salmon- both good.

Service was good.

Had some local IPA’s.

title: Excellent visit
text:
We booked admission and was all smooth. After block C , consider going straight up to the main Mansion house as will have the longest queue.inside the mansion house - it has a few exhibits but not much compared to the other huts.beware that the queue is outside so if it’s raining - will probably get drenched.

The D day hut was amazing and so was hut3,6,8&11.

It has so much more than exhibits that was expected and was a truly lovely day.

Would suggest 3-4 hours for the visit.

title: Good food
text:
Open for three weeks and good looked good on insta.

Firstly the music is far too loud for dinner and asked the waiter to see if it could be lowered but no avail. So subsequent could not hear what others were saying across the table.

Also found dish too salty. The sauce of the pork was too salty. The dish was other wise good. The padron pepper was good and so was the croquets. The scallops was ok.

The mains was good- fillet cooked medium rare with nice sauce and cabbage.

Desert was excellent !

Service was good.
Shame about the ambience and the excess salt otherwise would have been an excellent meal!

title: Good breakfast
text: Had breakfast here on a Saturday- day upstairs- good view of the harbour. Ordered the royale poached eggs. Good. Flat white was good- could be larger portions. Service was good.

title: Basic
text:
It’s basic- you get what you pay- circa £40.
Parking areas available at £5 per night to be paid at reception- there are two: one at the lower ground floor with a difficult entrance as not very visual and other across the road.

Check in was easy. Had room 116. Basic- nice bed. Overnight the room has a significant noise from the vent that required changing rooms to 201. 201 is a nicer room and slightly bigger.

Check out easy.

Staff were very accommodating and checked the vent in 201 before moving.
place: Premier Inn Ipswich Town Centre (Quayside) hotel

title: Great view
text:
Close service made worse by the covid distancing.

Had the sizzler which is a full English- was ok.
Flat whites was fine too.

Generally an average visit.

Best part is the view of the river Orwell and the estuary.

title: Good Japanese
text:
Had lunch here, food rolls both soft crab and tuna and avocado. The bugogi roll was not very nice.

Good aubergine with miso as well as eel and tuna nigiri.

Service attentive.

title: A Perfect stay....Almost
text:
Great location as 100 meters from where road ends to pedestrianised street.
Location is pretty amazing both for the Main Street and also for thr access to the main road.

There is no designated parking although when checked on tripadvisor mentions parking. Parked on the street which was ok as not busy this year.

Down three flight of stairs to the Canava suite which is part of the honeymoon category- interior is similar to a long white cave, cool interior with two seating area, dining area with kitchenette and also bed room as one space.

Interior was rather simplistic that took some time to grow on us. Some issues with water pipes overnight but otherwise relatively quite.

Mel and Antonio were attentive and helpful during the stay.Check in and out was easy and quick.

The highlight of our stay was the view, which was absolutely stunning and what Oia is famous for and the ease to get to shops and restaurants around Oia.

There are three honey moon suites which are off Different interior and terrace sizes. Dimitri’s has the largest terrace and next to the Atrina villa.Mina is large terrace but the partition wall cover the late evening sun. Canavas suites smallest terrace and has main stairs going down adjacent to the to the pool.Xenonas is on the seperate stair way which makes it much more private. Tony’s is next to the main staircase
and so is Thalos and the studio and therefore privacy in all was rather limited.

Cavavas suite Terrace had an amazing view- the Instagram view that is famous with an Olive tree that helped keep sun out if not too keen on tanning.there is also a parasol on the terrace.The sun shone the whole day with great views of sun rise and sunset. However if there were two persons wanting to tan- that could be an issue due to the limited space and the olive tree.

Breakfast as surprisingly basic- make your own tea and coffee , pastries from a bakery in plastic packages , yogurt, water and orange juice from a carton. We felt that this was similar to food on a plane.We went to Passarin bakery which is 30meters away which had excellent Baklava , coffee and orange juice. There is also Passagio at the start of the around the corner for proper coffee and orange juice- more effort could be made on this.

Wifi is painfully slow so we used our 3/4g.

A fantastic stay with some aspect that could be further improved.

title: Excellent baklava and also almond biscuit
text:
Found this place of chance- have the coffee from beee in the morning and the orange juice.
Also try the various little baklava’s that they have and the lovely almond biscuits- which you can take away in a box!

title: Excellent meal
text:
A surprising outcome of dinner where every dish was excellent.

Shared the Grilled eggplant which was outstanding- it looked like a vege burger- layers of aubergine, cheese and tomatoes with an amazing sauce of basil , mastelo and sour cream.

The dorado and veal were both amazing- the fish was cooked perfectly and the skin was crispy.
The veal had a star anise hint with Pearl barley sweat grilled carrots.

The Syrah glass of the red was excellent for the veal.

For desert the creme brûlée which was more of a Greek tiramisu- it had multiple players including coffee! Outstanding and not to be missed for coffee lovers.

Best area to dine is the courtyard at the front for dinner as has a nice relaxed airy ambience.

Service was attentive.

title: Beautiful sunset except for the crowds
text:
Oia a truly magical place to watch the sunset however, about a thousand other tourist had the same idea and were camped out at the north part of the town near the castle ruin to watch the sunset.

Nevertheless, a beautiful experience and a suggestion for the late evening.

title: Average and blend tasting Lunch with wine
text:
It’s a short drive from Oia.I would o recommend doing lunch at the Vassaltis Vineyard which has much better wines and food- see another review!

We had lunch with was a rather limited menu and struggled to find something we liked.

Interior was dark and a they have a lovely outdoor terrace.

The food was average to say the least- blend and uninteresting!

The Santorini plate was a disappointing dish of hard generally inedible bread which is the barley rusk with tomato paste and caper leaves on it with servings with sides olives, tasteless fava beans and sundries tomatoes.

Cycladic spring rolls was good and had a mixture feta cheese, sundried tomato, yogurt sauce- best for the three dishes.

The fava beans scrimp risotto also called Scrimp Favarotto was another average, tasteless dish with a rather poor show of 5 scrimps.

Wine tasting: we had the Kir-yianni 2018- rose sparking- good, white-Kavalerios 2018-average, Mavrotragano 2018- average.

Service was ok.

title: Average at best
text:
Not sure what the hype is but we had dinner and found the aubergine salad was similar to pickled aubergine with oil out of a pickle jar with some cheese and toasted bread.

The grilled scrimp was 4 scrimps which were over done till the meat was chewy and dry.

The only good thing about the meal was the moussaka.

House wine was average

Service was good.

title: Interesting food
text:
Can be difficult to find but the map on google and via trip advice are accurate.

Book before as there were a long queue of people trying to get a table without booing.

There are four seating area- ground floor inside, groundfloor courtyard and upstairs terrace and upstairs inside .A nice ambience.

Had bread with some dips before the starters.

Had the watermelon salad which was very interesting.

Got the 900g steak which is similar to a t-bone: was good but not outstanding-parts inside were rare : if not into very red will suggest more than medium-rare.

House wine was average.

Complimentary little departure slush.

Service was a bit slow albeit friendly.

title: Good chicken and pork Souvlaki
text:
Had a take away lunch of both chicken and pork souvlaki- took about 10mins to put together.

Tastes good- could do with more sauce and salad in the souvlaki.

Chips were unfortunately soggy by the time I got back which took a 5 minute walk.

title: Excellent place for food and wine tasting
text:
Fantastic place for a stop over to try some local wine- we had the

We also ordered a couple of dishes- sea bream ceviche, fresh tuna tataki and the eggplant caviar.All excellent and we had wines to pair with the food.

Favourite wines was the Assyrtico barrel aged 2015, Mavrotragano which is a red and went well with the tuna.

Fantastic service which was both interactive and suggestive.

Car would be the best way to get here as rather out of the way but only 8 mins from Thera( Fera ) by car- even a car park at the site.

title: Good food
text:
Had dinner here.

House wine was average.

Had the vegetable fritas which was nice- there different fillings . The baked fish was ok but too salty and the octopus was good.
Service was attentive.

title: Must have a audio guide
text:
Firstly our first attempt to visit on a Tuesday morning was a failure as it’s the only day they open at 1300-2000.

So we came back in the evening.

The first thing is without an audio guide you miss out on the important displays as there are so many.

Download Rick Steves guide which last 60mins for free.

Admission is 12euros.
There are some incredible piece such as the mask or argemenon , the transformation of statues from more geometrically formed to real life. The tomb stones and The little man on the horse.

I would suggest going up the stairs to see the millions of pots( no audio guide for this ) before continuing to the Roman artefacts.

All in all enjoyable with the audio guide- gives it purpose or you would be left just walking around aimlessly.

title: Amazing
text:
Always wanted to come and Sep 2020 was truly a great time.

The entrance was opposite the acropolis museum and I believe there is another entrance on the exit too.

No queues to buy the ticket , could also book tickets at the self ticket kiosk about 100meters before the main entrance.

It cost 20 euros for just the acropolis or 30 if you like to visit the other 6 sites offered in a 5 day period.

We downloaded the free audio from Rick Steves which is about an hour long. The first 20 minutes is a hot hike up to the theatre of Dionysus and then to the Propylaea.

Then through the Propylaea you will see the pantheon in front.

We were there at about 1030am and there we some shady spots. The status of the maidens in Erechtheum was beautiful.

Toward the far end is an amazing view point of the city of Athens. There was toilets half way up near the theatre of Dionysus as well as adjacent to the pantheon.

An amazing place! Wasn’t too crowded on Tuesday 15th September 2020!

title: Good food but they killed the Naxos steak
text:
Sat outside which is mixed as it’s busy and constant pedestrian as well as cyclists and occasional motorcycle.

Ordered the tuna tartar and the calamari ouzo- the tuna tartar was good, calamari was average.

Had the sea bass and Naxos steak for mains- the sea bass was overdone. The Naxos steak was meant to be medium rare and came rare and cold so sent it back and when it came back it was overdone and wasn’t rested enough so had a gameness to it.

House wines by the glass is good.

Good service.

Get a complimentary pistachio ice cream and parting shot.

title: Great location , noisy in the mornings
text:
Location good, heart of plaka, great eating places around the corner like NOLAN.

We stayed in room 831 which is a deluxe room with Acropolis views and terrace which was small but functional.

It has a nice view of the Acropolis but the city panorama is obscured partly by terrace in front

Room rather cramped at the entrance- the terrace lacks privacy both from neighbours as well as terrace across the way which is partly blocking the view. Atleast there is a view of the acropolis as per the room description. Noisy fridge which had to be unplugged and dangerous wardrobe handle which was impractical as well as sharp. Bed were at expected standards. Bathroom was nice with walk in shower which is large. Tea and coffee facilities was provided but only one tea bag for two so had to get more.

Noise from 6 am with street, bells ringing, furniture moving in the floor above were all a nuisance!

The pool is small with 12 sun beds and 4 pool beds. It has sun all day depending on which area. Rush to get the sun areas by 2.30pm but there is inadequate sun beds for number of guest.

Gym was functional- had to call to the spa to book a time slot- had two running machines, a cross trainer , a bench with weights from 2-20kg and a abs bench.

Breakfast was average- had to QR code book yourself in- but doesn’t really work so just went up anyway. it was buffet style but was served- fruits were unripe, the scrambled egg average, pastries were soggy. There is the option or ordering an omelette which they don’t tell you. Coffee was average. Orange juice is excellent as fresh, sit outside for the views. The pigeons during breakfast are a nuisance.

All in all a mixed stay for us.
Average stay for the price paid!

title: Amazing tasting menu
text:
Had the 4 course tasting menu and paired wine - was sat out in a lovely courtyard with nice romantic lighting and beautiful ambience.

We had a Greek rose sparking which was nice.

The 3 amouse bouche was good, followed by bread on the oil plate with tomatoes drops.

The starter of Dakos was light and fresh.
The crab was excellent.The lamb was rather gamey.Desert of Fig was excellent.

The white and red whites was good.
The desert wine called Silva was outstanding.

Service was good.

title: Amazing but unfortunately not able to offer all dishes
text:
Amazing fusion greek- Japanese food.

Modern and minimalist interior and exterior with outdoor seating.

Visited on a Monday lunchtime and had not received their fish order so a number of fish dishes were unable.

The 4 dishes ordered was amazing-
Had the zucchini with miso and smoked aubergine, the soba with salmon and tahini, the cod burger and the friend chicken.

Service is good.

title: Great introduction to Athens
text:
We had the Monday 945am tour with Jonathan- he was informative and entertaining. There was a group of over 20.

Started with the arch of Hadrian to the Olympics stadium , the park, the change of guards, presidential palace.

We then went to the academia, the market and a few other interesting areas.

The tour was generally a brief introduction with some interesting and funny comment.

The tour lasted 2hrs45 mins in total which was succinct and informative.

title: Excellent meal
text:
Pick this place after seeing the food of TA.

Interior is modern and you can view the kitchen via a glass window when you go to the toilet The food lives up to the pictures.

Firstly, there are two menus- the bar menu with starters and the mains as a loose paper form and desert and wines in a leather bound menu.

Ordered the duck cones in cauliflower, ahi tuna and the scrimp pops -all excellent.

Then had the brisk which melted in your mouth with the fries called everyone’s favourite- both amazing.

Cocktails was amazing too - had the Makers mark, illusion, talk to strangers: all great.

For desert- have the cobbler of the season which is for two and needs 40mins. It taste like Christmas cake with caramel ice cream.

Service was attentive.

title: Good food
text:
Had lunch here- sat outside.

The grilled vegetables was very good.

The Mediterranean spaghetti was average as a bit blend. The moussaka was ok- too much cheese and potatoes.

Service was good.

title: Great architecture and videos
text:
Couple of tips:
1.you can buy your tickets online and it valid for 2 hour slots.

2.There are a number of free tours( once you have bought your admission tickets) - Sunday at 1100 and Tuesday morning - look at the website for future information.

3.Don’t forget to go below the building for the archeological excavations.

The exterior and interior is stunning.
The ground floor is for minor gods , the first floor of the pre Parthenon and statues.
Best part is the videos about the restoration, the various artefacts.

The top floor has the various Parthenon displays as well as the frease. There is a good video about the built of the Parthenon.

Ideally more on-site tours would have made the experience more memorable.

title: Good sea bass but....
text:
Firstly, the tables for two are too small- had a number of accidents over the meal due to the lack of space. Sat inside next to the window which was very cramped.

Starters-dolomades was average and the Saganaki was good but a bit too much cheese it.

The grilled octopus was good but the tentacles was over done - needs a diffident cooking time to the rest of the main body.

Sea bass was excellent but came out about 20 mins after the grilled octopus which if you are having dinner with someone else puts a damper on the meal. The accompanied with quinoa salad good, mass with fish eggs was good.

Service was good and they were apologetic about the sea bass and knocked the wine off.

House wine was average-good value.

Complimentary desert is a nice touch.

title: Disappointing lunch menu
text:
Had lunch here at the beginning of September- was sunny outside but the interior was depressing and dark with low vaulted ceilings.

The lunch menu looked like a good deal but the starter of cockles on toast bread was average. It is odd to try to pair sea bass with a tomato based sauce but decided to try it which was awful- didn’t suit, the fish was fishy with anchovies so was extra pungent of fish! One to avoid - ideally needs a change of dish sauce.

The desert of half a peach roasted with some crispy bits was average and could be down at home.

Accompanied wine was basic- Sauv Blanc, Merlot or French rose.

Service was good.

title: Fantastic food and presentation
text:
Had dinner here a few weeks ago and opted for the 6 course tasting menu.

Pleasantly surprised by both the quality of the dishes and presentation.

The amouse bouche was outstanding with 5 dishes- all excellent. Particularly enjoyed the bread sticks,bread with various butters.

The seafood starters were both good.

Found the scallops rather fishy but overall was ok.

The wagyu beef Main was excellent and cooked to perfect as also the presentation.

The deserts was good- particular enjoyed the Cuban themed desert.

Service was good and attentive.

Truly a Gem- will be back to try the other tasting menus.

title: Good pizza
text:
Had dinner here-didn’t realise they had a black board with specials until later.

Order the pizza cappriosa and the gardini. The first was good but the gardini was a with raw vegetable-Rather average dish.

House wine was good - red better then white.

Desert of amoretti cake was good.

Service was good.

Will be back.

title: Decent Japanese
text:
Had lunch on Monday- some dishes better than others- like the soft shell crabs and the prawn skewers.

The rice paper wraps, the sashimi was average. Did not take to the saki.

Service was rather mixed and unfriendly.

title: Good food just needs a reduction in salt
text:
Second visit, love the interior combination.

Had the two course lunch- Spinach agnolotti and the terrine. Both good but the agnolotti sauce and mushrooms was too salt.

Mains of fish and chips
And pork belly, both cooked well but the fish was over salted and so was the chips. The condiments of potatoes, mash and cheese broccoli was all good.

Wines could be better value as average wine ratings.
Had the moron cocktail which was ok- wasn’t my thing.

Will be back!

title: Just incredible
text:
Second visit- first time in March just before lockdown for dinner, this time for lunch. Interior is absolutely stunning and would suggest a walk around as the interior of the downstairs parlour and other areas are stunning.

It’s a Theater for food. Service is excellent with a French accent!

The starters came as 7 dishes of various seafood such as sea urchin, pigeon pate, crab in open crispy pastry, a jelly, artichokes and a medley of seafood main starter dish, we were full after that.

Mains - amazingly cooked fish - spot on with accompaniment of Pak Choi and squid. desert was light as was already stuffed!

One of the best meals ever had and as full after starters!

title: Average food
text:
It’s part of the eat out to help out!

Long wait for service to order.

Small portions- 3 prawns and 4 calamari.
Patata brava was soggy.

Tacos was ok but came in non crisp / non toasted instead a small tortilla.

The pisco sour and caipirinhas was good. Food came fast once ordered!
place: Vivo Latino Restaurant and Cocktail Bar

title: Just Terrible !
text:
Post covid , had the usual temp a check on arrival.

Was informed that rooms would not be cleaned every morning as pre covid but only after check out.

Stayed on the 2nd floor in 228.

Hallway smelt of a combination of cigs and dusty carpet. Rooms equally smelt bad- in aired and a smell of cleaning products!

Room Interior looked aged with significant scuffs on the bed base, walls and side tablets- see photos! A real lack of detail from those managing to look and monitor the quality of rooms!

Side table glass was not secure and would move hence had cause previous damage to wall!

Defects ceiling in corridor, in wall papering, tatty curtains side, mould of shower frame.

Dirt from cleaning and cleaning items left on stairway.

Definitely not a five star hotel, 4 at best!

Just plain awful! The worse quality 5 star hotel I’ve stayed in with the worse room interior!

Won’t be returning!

title: Uncomfortably hot and un accommodating service
text:
Unfortunately they have turned off the aircon for covid but this makes the interior extremely and uncomfortably hot especially if the windows don’t open.
Therefore too hot and stuff that we decided to end the meal after the mains.
Had the three course with bubbly . Over priced wine list with mark up of X4!

Food was mixed- Foie grae and saddle of lamb was good, the fish main was overdone. Was too hot to finish the meal and decided not to have desert yet they brought out a small desert.

Won’t be coming back whilst they have their aircon off.

Service wasn’t great as completely could not accommodate the clients in the heat!
place: Seven Park Place By William Drabble

title: Excellent Saturday lunch
text:
Located a short distance from
South Kensington tube stop, has a clean modern interior.

Had the three course- excellent pea agnolotti, the warm celery was ok.

Mains- both the fish which has the most amazing crispy skin and chicken with amazing rich sauce were both excellent.

The desert of peanut and chocolate was good. The greengages was good- never had it before.

Service was good and so was carafe if white.

The truffles was so rich- was also excellent.

Would love to come back.

title: Good food and service
text:
Part of the eat out to help out.
It was hot - outside temp of 31’C so decided to sit out for dinner.

Order three starters- the shaksuka( aubergine and veg ratatouille) muska boregi ( triangle filo pastry with cheese) and the king prawns( de-headed in a nice red onion sauce) - all good
Portions and tasted delicious but tad on the oily and salty side.

The mixed meat grill for mains was also good- chicken and lamb in different cuts.
( big enough to share if your not too hungry! )

Had the cheese filo pasty desert with ice cream was really good but rather sweat.

Good service.

Will be back.

title: Good meal until got accosted
text:
Firstly it’s not part of the eat out to help out!

First time there, sat out - was great. Ordered 7 dishes- pulpo, padrons, prawns pilpil, dates with bacon and patatas bravas-all good and the churizo tortilla which was average.

It all went well until we got accosted by a person who looked like she was high on drugs rambling and looking rather glazed. We had to call the police but she left before hand.

Terrible experience but the price you pay for sitting outside! The street ambience around that area is rough!

title: Good food
text:
Came here for the eat out to help out on a Monday. Had the meat plater with some cut meat and cheese- did not enjoy this but the other ate most of it.

Had the pork schnitzel- that was excellent with the salad and chips. A Friend ordered the ham hock which he raves about.

Desert- tried the caramel cheese cake which was good and the fruit cheese cake had to too large fruit layer.

Service was good and friendly. Ambience was ok- bit dark in the back room- pub style ambience.

Will definitely be back.

title: Sub par
text:
The tables are more spaces out with in door and out door seating! Been here a few times and decided to go back after the first day of in door dining.

Ordered a number of usual dishes such as the devilled chicken wings,prawns, polenta mushrooms, lady’s fingers - all too sweat! The hoppers were hard, not crispy and too thick. The paratas tasteless.

title: The worse service ever experienced
text:
Having been here before I was shocked by the terrible service.

Sat in the extension serviced by probably the worse Waitering service- chopsticks thrown on the table, wrong order, when asked for a recommendation- informed by the waiter that does not like fish.

When wanted to order again- was given the hand to wait rather than a simple vocalisation of give me a second or moment.

It’s such a shame because the food is excellent but unfortunately the experience is based on the Waitering too which is where the experience is completely ruined!

There need to be a re-evaluation of the Waitering service.

Will not be back!

title: Excellent hotel with amazing food
text:
We have been coming to the same spot for 7 years. Well done for the recent status upgrade from a 4 star superior to 5 star with the additional of the roof top terrace and the soon to be built wellness centre.

It’s family run hotel by a Swiss German couple and their son. Clients are generally from the Swiss- german nations. Menus are in a number of languages including English.

Go for the half board as the evening meals off 5courses is amazing- almost Michelin standard- only set back is getting into you clothes after the holiday.There is also an amazing selection of wine- try the Chardonnay from Majorca from the vineyard In Manacor.

Our favourite room is 205 with a massive terrace overlooking the salt fields.

Breakfast post covid is mostly table service with a variety of items from fruits, meat and cheese platter also with cooked toastier of avocado, tomato and beef or scrambled eggs. There is the added selection of eggs, cooked Spanish items like Tumbet with Spanish sausages or creamed spinach and bacon. The crepe was average.

Things to do near by- the beach is a 5
Mins walk away but we generally walk the 45 mins to Es Trenc- check out the other entry.

Highlight of the day has to be dinner with the amazing 5 course meal- start with salad, then the most amazing selection of soups from veloute/ consomme, a entree plate of sashimi, scallops and even had rabbit.
Mains portions are adjusted for the number of dishes so on the smaller side- the fish selection was amazing. Desert could do with a bit more imagination- the tiramisu is excellent and there is always a desert dish of the day.

Staff is friendly including Jungen at the front desk, Miriam, Pilar,Dennis and the owners son Christian.

Will be back next year as always!

title: Beautiful beach
text:
It’s a bit of a walk from the end of Colonia sant Jordi- about 45mins. There is also a closer walk from Sa Rapita and the middle point with the car park.

It has a lot of sea weeds on the first day but they must clean the beaches in the morning as the subsequent days the beach had been returned to its natural beauty.

Clear white sands with turquoise waters and very flat sea beds with the very occasional rock. It’s the kind of scene from somewhere in the carribean.

Sunday’s was a bit busier but the week days was fairly quite and you could space out!

I have added some photos of when there was a layer of seaweed at the waterfront to wards the later and the photos when it had been removed at the start.

title: Second time here, even better this time!
text:
Second time here, last time two years ago. Must say it was even better this time.

Had an inside table for 1330 on a Saturday.

Has the lunch tasting menu which was mind blowing.

Beautiful dishes of black cod followed by amazing rice dish that taste like it had lobster bisque in it, a hake dish- again excellent.

Chicken for the main which was delicious as wrapped with meat.

The Moroccan memory desert was really interesting with chocolate and cardamom spices.

Very attentive waitering and a table visit but the man himself.

Excellent experience.

title: Take away experience
text:
In times of covid, Heaney’s has a take away service only.

You call up after 2pm and put in an order and given a pick up time.

Arrived just before pick up of 6.30pm ,
There was 3 people outside- only on person is allows in at any one time. After about 10mins went in and was told that order on the way. Few minutes later came out with order.

Had the fried chicken- really good but a bit salty.

The ox cheeks and the pork bbq unfortunately got a bit cold although was in the oven.

Chips was amazing , ox cheeks good. The bbq bagel wasn’t that great- got soggy and the dressing too sweat with too much fat on the meat.

The sticky toffee was rather disappointing as it was dry and had little sauce to it.

Was good to try the food- an option if you don’t fancy cooking and you live in pontcanna.

title: Amazing
text:
Wonderful entrance and the drama of the various art works. Would suggest asking for a tour of the various bars that they have which have different themes- we did that at the end.

There’s two big dinning rooms at the top floor, the first is much more styling than the second which has more or of an eastern feel.

We went for the ala carta as each course comes with 5 different dishes which sounded more exciting that the tasting menu. The langoustine starter was amazing and so was the seafood mains. I had the grand desert which was also excellent.

Had a bottle of Blanc de blanc and also a bottle of red. Excellent service.

Price- starters and mains £60 and grand desert-£22. So for 16 dishes for £142: pretty amazing!

Perfect meal!

title: Good bento box
text:
Visited with friends, usually massive queue outside, at the moment- got a table upstairs.

Ordered the eel bento box- was very nice.
The chicken katsu was good as was the chicken teriyaki.

Service was good.

Nice green tea.
Over the mochi desert especially the mango, green tea and the coconut.

title: Fantastic tasting menu
text:
Wonderful place- warm welcome. We walked in without booking on a Friday night after the Saatchi Gallery and first a table at 7pm.

Had the tasting 8 course.

The negroni is a must as they do their own mix with a bit of Port in it.

The amouse was amazing with three small tastings. Followed by the first course which was also 3 small tasting- both amazing.

The Foie gras was superb, the cod good, the cabbage was a surprise as it had chicken base, the short ribs was rather complex and both deserts excellent.

Service was fantastic start to finish.

Excellent experience.

title: Amazing food
text:
Beautiful interior.

Fantastic service.
Amazing food from amouse bouche to desert and even petit fours.

Highlights- the scallops starter, the haunche of venison, rhubarb layered cake.

Service was attentive.

Will certainly be back.

title: Excellent food
text:
Read about it and decided to try it out on a Saturday for lunch.

Ordered from the lunch menu- had the pre starters or mushroom croquettes and fried chicken- both dishes were excellent.

Then had the beef tartar which was very balanced and the celeriac volute again excellent, slightly sweat.

The pork belly mains was excellent. The fish cakes was good but did not live up to the other excellent dishes.

The chocolate mousse was rich and nice. Rice pudding with rhubarb was good too.

Service was excellent and friendly.

Style interior, relaxed style dining.

Will be back!

title: Fantastic dinner
text:
Had a wonderful Saturday night meal here.

Started of with some wonderful finger food- all excellent and interesting taste.

The consome was excellent with a very fragrant almost Asian ravioli. Excellent chicken bread reminded me of Chinese steam buns with crispy onion on the top.
The fish was average- found it a bit too salty and sour with a lemon flavour - wasn’t very moist.

Again Duck was good. Both excellent pre- desert and desert of rhubarb.

Chose to have wine but not paired.

good service.

title: Excellent
text:
Had lunch here on Saturday 29th of Feb. Was expecting it to be busier- was the 3rd table.

Had the lunch menu.
Excellent bread to start.
Amazing squid and beetroot salad.
The squid was really divine with risotto rice in ink.

The cod was excellent, cooked to perfection- had a tumeric and cumin flavour with excellent gratin and cauliflowers.

Desert of rhubarb was excellent with a custard disk.

Great service.

Highly recommended!

title: Average at best
text:
Greeted by stressed out staff.
Fold interior as front door open all the time in winter.

Slow service- 20mins for a flat white to stay in!

Flat white- taste of milk that’s been warmed up too many times- slight sour almost off taste.

Carrot cake- way too sweat! Need to reduce on sugar. Add icing on top does not help.

title: Excellent tasting menu
text:
Located in the Belmond, was just a quick walk down from the room.

Had the tasing menu which was excellent as could choose which dishes fancied.

The amouse bouche and crab cake starter was average . The scallop second starter was good. Outstanding Foie gras which I had for desert rather than a starter and the lamb main- both one of the best I’ve had.

Excellent petit four.

Service was excellent.

A must in Charleston or for an occasional!

title: Terribly sad but amazing museum
text:
The museum really bring the air of sadness when you go around. There is extensive information about the building. The attack of the twin towers and the other places of attack with videos, voice recordings and multitude of artifacts.

Download the museum app which allows you have a guided tour.

One of the best and saddest museums I have been to.

I think 3hours and more to see all.

title: Good Foie Gras
text:
Tried the main restaurant and was busy so managed to get a table for lunch on Sunday via opentable.

It’s a much smaller place- degree of French rusticness.

There was a lunch menu but opted for the Foie Gras- was good.

Has a Cote de rhone red.

Service was good.

title: Not all dishes are that good
text:
Extremely busy on sat night at 1845- long queue even for those reserved to be seated.

Was seated upstairs- cocktail for bar was ok- lychee sake with coconut water.

Ordered the steam dumpling- that was good. The roast pork rib starters was dry and didn’t have much taste other then crunchy fat.

Ordered the pork chop which was a large portion but the pork was sadly dry and ate a little and left the rest. The marinade was a little odd too.

Extremely busy environment.

title: Over priced
text:
It’s has a lovely interior and great views of the vessel.

Starters of sea urchin and oysters was good but not outstanding.
The crab cake once again was average with a nice sauce.

The beef Wellington was extremely disappointing as it tasted like an average dish. The meat wasn’t great tasting either with too much pastry around and wasn’t crispy or flakey.

Cocktails was good again above the standard price.
Service was good.

title: Excellent oysters
text:
Sat at the bar- was good fun.

Amazing oysters- had the platter for half dozen: was amazing.

The dumplings next but was average.

Had the US blanc de Blanc- was average.

Service was good.

title: Good food
text:
Based in the Vendue Hotel.
Arrived for dinner rather late at 9.45 pm and was pretty empty.

Had the beetroot salad with cheese and nuts which was good but was really something I could make at home.

The Scrimp and grit was excellent and well presented.

Service was good.
